oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pseudomonas aeruginosa mastitis in goats was also isolated from an essential oil-based teat dip
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilson, D. J.
Kelly, E. J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pseudomonas aeruginosa
mastitis
dairy goats
etiologic agent
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pseudomonas aeruginosa is an opportunistic pathogen that has been associated with mastitis in dairy animals, including goats (Yuan et al, 2017). An outbreak of mastitis in dairy goats was investigated at the Utah Veterinary Diagnostic Laboratory (UVDL). Identification of the etiologic agent(s) and source of infection was the primary objective.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 411
